FDG.function_description: Walmart shopping: browse, search, shop clearance

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Walmart app's main page (page 0). The user clicks the 'Shop' bottom tab (action at [0,10]), which keeps the app on the same page (page 0) to browse, search, or shop clearance items. There are no branches or loops here as it's a single action to access the shopping interface.

steps.summary: Click 'Shop' bottom tab to access shopping interface

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to sign in to their existing Walmart account or initiate the creation of a new account by entering a phone number or email address and proceeding with the "Continue" button.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the 'Sign In' button (S1) to open the sign-in/account creation modal. In the modal (S2), the user can either close the modal (S3) or input a phone number/email (S4) and then click 'Continue' (S5) to proceed with account verification or creation. The 'Continue' action loops back to the same modal page (S2) to allow re-entry if needed, while closing the modal exits the flow.

steps.summary: Click 'Sign In' button to open the sign-in modal
Click 'Close modal' button to exit the sign-in flow
Input phone number or email in the input field
Click 'Continue' button to proceed with account verification/creation (loops back to S2)

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Walmart app provides search suggestions related to "wireless earbuds" to help the user refine their search and quickly navigate to relevant product listings.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Walmart app's main page (page 0) and inputs 'wireless headphones' into the search field (step S1), navigating to page 2. On page 2, the user can either continue with the input (step S2) or clear the search input (step S3), with these two options forming an if-else branch at step S1.

steps.summary: Input 'wireless headphones' into Walmart search field
Input 'wireless headphones' into search input field on page 2
Click clear search input button on page 2

FDG.function_description: The current page (Walmart Scanner) enables users to scan barcodes or QR codes to check item prices/availability, add items to cart, checkout with Walmart Pay, add receipts to purchase history, and perform other shopping - related actions, with an introductory prompt to guide users through its functionality.
data_out: return to main shop page state

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0 and clicks the barcode scan icon to enter the scanner page (page 3). On page 3, the user can either click 'Got it' to confirm the introductory prompt (ending the flow) or click the back arrow to return to page 0 (restarting the flow).

steps.summary: Click barcode scan icon to open scanner page
Click 'Got it' to confirm scanner prompt
Click back arrow to return to page 0

FDG.function_description: The page displays an empty shopping cart in the Walmart app, notifying the user that their cart has no items and providing a "Start shopping" button to begin adding products, along with a search bar for finding Walmart items.
data_out: navigation back to search results page

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Walmart app's main page (page 0). First, they click the shopping cart icon (action [0,3]) to navigate to the shopping cart page (page 4). Then, if they want to return to the previous page, they can click the back navigation arrow (action [4,0]) to go back to page 20 (or the prior page context).

steps.summary: Click shopping cart icon to go to cart page
Click back arrow to return to prior page

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to select or add a pickup or delivery location (either a shipping address or a Walmart store) to proceed with shopping, browsing, or purchasing clearance items on Walmart.
data_out: updated pickup or delivery location options

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main Walmart page. The user clicks the pickup/delivery location selector (at the top right, showing the current location). This opens a menu where the user can then choose to add a shipping address or select a Walmart store for pickup/delivery, enabling them to proceed with shopping, browsing, or purchasing clearance items.

steps.summary: Click the pickup/delivery location selector (showing current location) to open the location selection menu.

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Walmart app enables users to search for products, choose pickup or delivery options, explore meal - related categories (such as budget - friendly dinners and quick - delivery dinner slots), and access different shopping - related features via the bottom navigation bar.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Walmart app's main page (page 0). The user clicks the 'Shop now' banner button, which navigates to a new page (page 6) focused on meal - related shopping options like dinner delivery slots and budget - friendly dinner categories.

steps.summary: Click the 'Shop now' banner button to navigate to the meal - related shopping page.

FDG.function_description: Pause banner carousel button

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. The user clicks the pause banner carousel button, which transitions the app to page 7. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click the pause banner carousel button

FDG.function_description: The page enables users to browse, search, and shop for discounted items in Walmart's end - of - year clearance sale, with options to filter by categories like price ranges and seasonal, and view product details and pricing for purchase.
data_out: search interface reset (no search query, no filtered results)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main page and clicks 'View all clearance' to access the clearance section. Once there, they can search for items (e.g., 'vacuum cleaner') in the input field. Alternatively, they can clear the search text or cancel the search, leading to different branches of the flow.

steps.summary: Click 'View all clearance' link to enter clearance section
Input search term (e.g., 'vacuum cleaner') in clearance search field
Click 'Clear search text' button
Click 'Cancel search' button
Confirm search input (e.g., 'vacuum cleaner') to proceed

FDG.function_description: Displays details of the "Best Choice Products Kids 24V Ride On Truck" (including price, shipping, returns, images) and provides options to buy now or add to cart, along with sharing, favoriting, and zooming features for the product.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the product card to view its details. Then, a second thumbnail image is clicked to explore more visuals. After that, the flow branches: either the cart quantity is decreased or increased, depending on the user's choice.

steps.summary: Click the product card to view its details page
Click the second product thumbnail image
Click the decrease cart quantity button
Click the increase cart quantity button

FDG.function_description: Favorite heart icon (product)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0. The user clicks the favorite heart icon (product) at the specified position. This action leads to page 10, completing the interaction with the favorite heart icon for the product.

steps.summary: Click the favorite heart icon (product) on page 0

FDG.function_description: The current page (under "My Items" tab) in the Walmart app allows users to access, manage, or view their saved lists (after signing in) and also provides options for reordering items and managing registries.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the 'My Items' bottom tab (from page 0 to 11). Then, on page 11, the user can either click the 'Lists' navigation tab (to view saved lists) or click the 'Add' button for Bounty paper towels (to manage items). These are two distinct branches from the 'My Items' page.

steps.summary: Click 'My Items' bottom tab to navigate to My Items page
Click 'Lists' tab to access saved lists
Click 'Add' button for Bounty paper towels to manage items

FDG.function_description: The "Ask Sparky" page functions as an interface to interact with Walmartâ€™s AI shopping assistant, Sparky, which offers help with shopping needs after signing into a Walmart account, and includes a chat input area and cart summary.
data_out: navigation back to Walmart home page

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main Walmart page. First, the user clicks the 'Ask Sparky' bottom tab to navigate to the Ask Sparky page. Then, on the Ask Sparky page, the user can input a query into the chat field. There is also an option to navigate back to the main page using the back arrow.

steps.summary: Click 'Ask Sparky' bottom tab to navigate to Ask Sparky page
Input query into chat input field on Ask Sparky page
Click back navigation arrow to return to main page

FDG.function_description: The current page in the Walmart app (Services tab) provides access to various Walmart services (e.g., Pharmacy, Auto Services, Custom Cakes), store tools (e.g., Walmart Pay, price checking, store maps), and additional services, enabling users to explore and utilize Walmart's non - shopping service offerings and store - related tools.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Shop page (page 0) and clicks the Services bottom tab. This action navigates to the Services page (page 13), where various Walmart services (e.g., Pharmacy, Auto Services) and store tools (e.g., Walmart Pay, price checking) are displayed for exploration. There are no decision or loop points in this flow.

steps.summary: Click the Services bottom tab to navigate to the Services page.

FDG.function_description: The Account page in the Walmart app enables users to sign in or create an account to manage orders, customize profiles, track savings/rewards, access purchase history to track orders, view subscription plans (like Walmart+), and explore privacy - related options.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the main Walmart app page. The user clicks the 'Account' bottom tab, which navigates to the Account page. From the Account page, users can then choose to sign in/create an account (to manage orders, customize profiles, track savings/rewards) or interact with other options like purchase history, subscriptions, or privacy settings.

steps.summary: Click the Account bottom tab to navigate to the Account page

FDG.function_description: The current page, Walmart's Privacy & Security page, provides information about Walmart's privacy notices and practices, outlining how the company handles personal information to maintain the trust of customers, associates, representatives, and service providers.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 1 (Sign in/account creation). They click the 'Privacy measures' link, which navigates to page 17 (Walmart's Privacy & Security page) to view privacy-related information.

steps.summary: Click the 'Privacy measures' link to navigate to the Privacy & Security page.

FDG.function_description: Displays search results for "wireless headphones" on Walmart, allowing users to browse, view details, and take actions (like selecting options) for various wireless headphone products, with filtering and sorting options available.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 2. The user clicks the 'wireless headphones' search suggestion (action_ref [2,2]), which navigates to page 20 displaying search results for wireless headphones. On page 20, users can browse products, view details, and take actions like selecting options, with filtering/sorting available (though no further actions are specified here).

steps.summary: Click search suggestion 'wireless headphones' to view results

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manually enter a 12 - 14 digit item barcode number (with an option to switch to entering receipt codes) and then search for the corresponding item in the Walmart system.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 3 and clicks the 'Type your barcode' button to navigate to the manual entry page (page 37). On page 37, the user inputs a 12 - 14 digit item barcode number into the input field. Then, the user clicks the 'Search' button to initiate the search for the corresponding item in the Walmart system.

steps.summary: Click 'Type your barcode' button to go to manual entry page
Input 12 - 14 digit item barcode number
Click 'Search' button to search for the item

FDG.function_description: The page displays an empty shopping cart and provides a "Start shopping" button to navigate back to the main shopping interface to browse and add items to the cart.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the empty shopping cart page (page 4). The core action is clicking the 'Start shopping' button, which navigates back to the main shopping interface to browse and add items to the cart. There are no branches or loops here, just a single action to transition from the empty cart page to the shopping interface.

steps.summary: Click the 'Start shopping' button to navigate to the main shopping interface

FDG.function_description: This page allows users to sign in to their existing Walmart account or create a new one by entering their phone number or email address to proceed with account - related actions (such as managing pickup/delivery addresses after initiating the address - adding process).

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 5 (the main shop page). The user clicks the 'Add Address' button, which navigates to page 1 (the sign - in or account - creation page) to proceed with account - related actions for address management.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add Address' button to navigate to the account - related page.

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to browse dinner delivery options (with a timeslot booking feature) and explore budget - friendly meal categories like easy meals, family meals under $10, etc., on the Walmart app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 6 (the dinner delivery/budget meals page). They click the 'Book timeslot' button, which remains on the same page (page 6) to complete the timeslot booking for dinner delivery, while also having the option to explore budget - friendly meal categories on this page.

steps.summary: Click the 'Book timeslot' button to start the timeslot booking process (staying on the same page)

FDG.function_description: The current page on the Walmart app allows users to browse dinner delivery options (with a timeslot booking feature) and explore budget - friendly meal categories like easy meals, family meals under $10, etc., to facilitate meal planning and shopping.
data_out: Easy Meals for less card interaction result

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 6 (the dinner - related page). They click on the 'Easy Meals for less' card. Since there are no further actions or branches provided, the flow ends after this click action.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Easy Meals for less' card

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to browse and shop seasonal clearance items as part of Walmart's end - of - year clearance, with options to filter by various criteria like price, brand, and in - store availability, and also to search within the clearance items.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the end - of - year clearance page. They click the 'Seasonal clearance category button' to browse seasonal clearance items. This action keeps them on the same page, likely updating the displayed items to show only seasonal clearance products.

steps.summary: Click the seasonal clearance category button to view seasonal clearance items

FDG.function_description: The page functions to display and allow browsing of seasonal clearance items as part of Walmart's end - of - year clearance, with options for filtering and searching within this clearance category.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the end - of - year clearance page. The user can perform the action of clicking the 'Add to cart' button for a clearance item. There are no branches or loops as it's a single action step for adding a clearance item to the cart.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add to cart' button for a clearance item

FDG.function_description: The current page is a "Sort & Filter" interface for end - of - year clearance items on Walmart, enabling users to sort and filter the items using various criteria like sort order, cash offers, customer rating, color, deals, availability, departments, retailer, and gifting options, and then view the filtered results.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the end - of - year clearance results page (page 8). First, the user clicks the filter options toggle button to open the 'Sort & Filter' modal (page 40). In the modal, the user can either click the 'Sort by' dropdown to adjust sorting criteria, close the modal, or click the 'View results' button to see the filtered items. After taking an action in the modal, the flow may return to the results page or move to other relevant pages based on the action.

steps.summary: Click filter options toggle button to open Sort & Filter modal
Click to close Sort & Filter modal and return to results page
Click Sort by dropdown to adjust sorting criteria
Click View results button to see filtered clearance items

FDG.function_description: This page enables users to sign in to their existing Walmart account or initiate the creation of a new account by entering a phone number or email address and proceeding, as part of the checkout process after attempting to buy the UBesGoo toy car.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the product page (page 9). The user clicks the 'Buy now' button, which navigates to the 'Sign in or create your account' page (page 1) to begin the account sign-in or creation process for checkout.

steps.summary: Click 'Buy now' button to proceed to account sign-in/creation page

FDG.function_description: After adding a product to the cart, this page offers a Walmart Protection Plan by Allstate, presenting plan details and options to purchase the 3 - year plan for $29.00 or decline the plan with "No Thanks".

core_logic.logic: After adding a product to the cart (via the 'Add to cart' button), the app presents a Walmart Protection Plan popup. At this point, the user can either purchase the 3 - year plan (by clicking the relevant button) or decline the plan (by clicking 'No Thanks' or closing the popup).

steps.summary: Click 'Add to cart' button to add product to cart and open protection plan popup
Click 'Close popup button (X)' to decline protection plan and close popup
Click '2 - Year Protection Plan button' (or relevant plan purchase button) to purchase the protection plan

This is a single-step action with no branches, as the click directly navigates to the next page (or toggles the favorite state, with the UI update reflected in the navigation to page 48).

steps.summary: Click the Favorite (heart) icon on the product details page.

FDG.function_description: The page provides options to share the product (Best Choice Products kids ride - on truck) via methods like Message, Email, Copy, or More, and also has a "Shop With Friends" toggle to let friends rate the item.

steps.summary: Click Share icon to open share modal
Click Close share modal button to return to product page

Click zoom in image button
Click zoom out image button
Click product image thumbnail to switch image

Click increase quantity button

FDG.function_description: This page enables users to sign in to their existing Walmart account or create a new one by entering their phone number or email address and proceeding, with a focus on personal information security.

FDG.function_description: The current page (Walmart's Privacy & Security page) provides information about Walmart's privacy notices, outlining how the company values and handles personal information from customers, associates, representatives, and service providers.

FDG.function_description: The current page displays Walmart.com's Terms of Use, providing legal information about the usage of Walmart's websites and applications, including an introduction, arbitration provisions, and other terms governing user access and interaction.

FDG.function_description: This page enables users to sign in to their existing Walmart account or initiate the process to create a new account by entering their phone number or email address and proceeding.

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a Walmart shopping cart interface, allowing users to view the item(s) in their cart, check pickup and delivery options, review shipping details and costs, and proceed to checkout to complete their purchase.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the cart icon to open the cart page. On the cart page, users can either click the pickup/delivery options dropdown to review or adjust those options (and stay on the cart page) or click the 'Continue to checkout' button to proceed to checkout. The dropdown action is a leaf (no navigation), while 'Continue to checkout' navigates to the next page.

steps.summary: Click cart icon to open cart page
Click pickup/delivery dropdown to review options (stays on cart)
Click 'Continue to checkout' to proceed to checkout

FDG.function_description: The Walmart Pharmacy page enables users to refill, track, and manage prescriptions (after signing in), learn about and schedule updated vaccines, and access other pharmacy - related services like My Health, Vision Center, and Insurance Services, while also promoting pharmacy delivery.
